title: High Social Contributions
description: In 2023, South Korea's social contributions reached a staggering 195,955,725,484,390 LCU, showcasing a robust social security system.

title: Strong Revenue Generation
description: South Korea generated 658,831,362,225,453 LCU in revenue excluding grants in 2023, indicating a strong fiscal position.

title: Significant Tax Revenue
description: In 2023, South Korea collected 351,646,677,140,000 LCU in tax revenue, reflecting effective tax policies.

title: High Goods and Services Expense
description: The country spent 85,193,470,173,742 LCU on goods and services in 2023, highlighting substantial public sector investment.

title: Large Subsidies and Transfers
description: In 2023, South Korea allocated 467,328,215,967,432 LCU to subsidies and other transfers, supporting economic stability.

title: Robust Private Sector Investment
description: South Korea's gross fixed capital formation in the private sector was 607,369,100,000,000 LCU in 2023, indicating strong private investment.

title: High Hospital Bed Availability
description: With 12.75 hospital beds per 1,000 people in 2021, South Korea boasts one of the highest healthcare capacities globally.

title: High Suicide Mortality Rate Among Females
description: In 2021, the suicide mortality rate for females was 16.94 per 100,000, indicating a significant mental health challenge.

title: Aging Female Population
description: In 2023, 8.23% of South Korea's female population was aged 60-64, highlighting demographic challenges.

title: Low Mortality Rate from Non-Communicable Diseases
description: In 2021, South Korea reported a mortality rate of 6.9% from cardiovascular diseases, cancer, diabetes, or chronic respiratory diseases among individuals aged 30 to 70, one of the lowest globally.

title: Minimal Prevalence of Child Malnutrition
description: As of 2020, only 0.2% of female children under five were underweight, and 0.9% were stunted, showcasing South Korea's effective child nutrition programs.

title: High Literacy Proficiency Among Primary Pupils
description: In 2019, less than 1% of primary school pupils in South Korea were below the minimum reading proficiency, indicating a strong education system.

title: Low Net Secondary Income
description: In 2023, South Korea recorded a net secondary income of -4,894,500,000,000 LCU, indicating a significant outflow of current transfers abroad.

title: Balanced Age Dependency Ratio
description: With a young age dependency ratio of 15.5% in 2023, South Korea maintains a balanced demographic structure, supporting economic stability.
